'Koninklijke Luchtvaart Maatschappij N.V.' (Royal Aviation Company), known by
its initials 'KLM', is the flag carrier airline of the Netherlands. KLM's
headquarters is in Amstelveen near its hub at Amsterdam Airport Schiphol. KLM operates worldwide scheduled passenger and cargo services to
more than 90 destinations. It is the oldest airline in the world still operating
under its original name. it had 31,787 employees. Facts & Figures|publisher=
KLM|accessdate=26 May 2011}}

The merger of KLM with Air France in May 2004 created Air France-KLM, which is
incorporated under French law with headquarters at Paris-Charles de Gaulle
Airport. Both Air France and KLM continue to fly under their distinct brand
names. Air France-KLM is part of the SkyTeam alliance.
categories: Multinational companies headquartered in the Netherlands
